abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan recognizes
            Indonesia's strong macroeconomic performance and
            progress on its reform agenda. While the macroeconomic
            situation is strong and reform progress is continuing,
            better outcomes, including higher growth and poverty
            reduction, require addressing areas of weakness in the
            investment climate; governance and public financial
            management; and service delivery. This DPL 4, a
            single-tranche operation based on completed actions
            demonstrating substantive progress, supports the Government
            reform program in these areas. DPL 4 builds on reforms
            undertaken under DPLs 1-3, complements a proposed program of
            Infrastructure DPLs, and sets the groundwork for an expanded
            policy dialogue for future DPLs under the new Country
            Partnership Strategy (CPS).
